breadcrumbs.title: Check if your vehicle is affected

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["If you want to drive a lorry, bus, coach or other specialist heavy diesel vehicle in the Low Emission Zone (LEZ) without paying a daily charge, it needs to meet certain emissions standards."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Currently, these vehicles must meet the Euro IV standard for particulate matter (PM), whether used for commercial or for private purposes.
On 26 October 2020 we will introduce stronger LEZ emissions standards London-wide for heavy vehicles including lorries, buses and coaches.
Petrol or diesel vehicles in central London must also meet new Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) standards , even if you meet LEZ standards.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What are the emissions standards?"}

The LEZ emissions standards are based on Euro standards for the emission of PM. PM is very fine particles of soot emitted by vehicles, which have an effect on health. This type of pollution can contribute to asthma, heart and lung disease, other respiratory illnesses and even early death.
The age and weight of a vehicle indicate the level of PM it produces.

The table below shows those diesel vehicles which don't meet the LEZ emissions standards. If you own any of the vehicles listed, you will need to take action before driving within the LEZ, or pay the daily charge .

{"template":"table","titles":["Diesel vehicles that don't meet the LEZ emissions standards (when registered as new before 1 October 2006)","Vehicle type","Weight"],"rows":[[],[],["Lorries\u003cbr /\u003eMotor caravans\u003cbr /\u003eMotorised horseboxes\u003cbr /\u003eBreakdown and recovery vehicles\u003cbr /\u003eSnow ploughs\u003cbr /\u003eGritters\u003cbr /\u003eRefuse collection vehicles\u003cbr /\u003eRoad sweepers\u003cbr /\u003eConcrete mixers\u003cbr /\u003eFire engines\u003cbr /\u003eTippers\u003cbr /\u003eRemoval lorries\u003cbr /\u003eOther specialist vehicles","More than 3.5 tonnes gross vehicle weight"],["Buses\u003cbr /\u003eCoaches (with 8+ passenger seats)","More than 5 tonnes gross vehicle weight"]]}
If your vehicle isn't included in this table, use our tools to check if your vehicle is affected .
If your vehicle is affected by the LEZ, find out what your options are .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Early adopters"}

Some vehicles first registered shortly before 1 October 2006 will also meet the LEZ Euro IV standard as some manufacturers started producing and using engines which met the Euro IV standard before this date. These vehicles are known as 'early adopters'.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Find out if your vehicle is an early adopter and what you need to do","url":"/ruc-cdn/static/cms/documents/early-adopters.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 752KB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Vehicles need to meet the Euro IV standard for PM. Vehicles registered as new on or after 1 October 2006 are assumed to meet these standards.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Does my vehicle meet the standards?"}
The quickest way to check if your vehicle meets the standards is to enter your number plate details into our vehicle checker or use our vehicle type tool.
Check if your vehicle is affected .
Your vehiclewill meet the current emissions standards if:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["It was first registered as new\u003cstrong\u003eon or after 1 October 2006\u003c/strong\u003e , or","You have received a Low Emission Certificate (LEC) or a Reduced Pollution Certificate (RPC) for fitting an approved full filter or converting to an approved gas engine"]}
You will then be free to drive within the LEZ without taking any action.
Your vehiclewill not meet the current emissions standards if:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["It was first registered as new any time\u003cstrong\u003ebefore 1 October 2006\u003c/strong\u003e , or","You currently hold a LEC or an RPC but you have only fitted a partial filter, or","You have received a LEC or an RPC for an Eligible Engine (these no longer meet the LEZ standards), or","You have received an RPC which has box 'M' ticked (this can be found under the 'Particulate trap fitted or modification type used' section of the certificate)"]}
If any of these are true, then you'll need to take action if you want to drive within the LEZ without paying the daily charge.
